candidates.title: chore: update dependencies
candidates.body:
Updates `bundlr` to v0.2.0 to get away from the OpenSSL requirement and bumps other non-Solana and Metaplex packages.

Closes #176.

candidates.title: feat(logging): add solana-logger
candidates.body: I tested it on a few commands and the default value of `info` doesn't seem to produce messages (which would interrupt our normal std output). If we find it does we can shift the default level to `error` or turn it off by default.

candidates.title: refactor(upload): added uploader trait
candidates.body:
Improved the way that new upload methods can be implemented:

- [x] Creation of a new `Uploader` trait to be implemented by all upload methods.
- [x] Threading logic was moved from each upload method to a new `ParallelUpload` trait. This avoids code duplication and simplifies the implementation.
- [x] Moved upload method implementation under a new methods sub-module. New methods only (or ideally) need to add/modify files from this module.
- [x] Refactor nft.storage upload to improve performance (uploading batches of files)

candidates.title: Feat: Automatically mint collection NFT if in assets folder
fix(update): update command was not updating seller fee basis points
Bump version for hidden settings fix
candidates.body: Also adds /.idea to .gitignore to play nicer with intellij

candidates.title: chore: bump version for new release
Support candy machine change
candidates.body:
- [x] bump anchor to 0.24.2
- [x] Consume new candy crate
- [x] implement collection commands
- [ ] separate mint spl token with mint if txn is too big
- [ ] implement collections into create config and stuff

candidates.title: Improved cache file synchronization in upload/deploy
candidates.body:
Couple of improvements:
1. cache file is synchronized periodically instead of at each tx completion; this improves the performance for large cache file sizes
2. added `ctrl+c` handler to gracefully stop the upload/deploy

candidates.title: Refactored to use candy machine pubkey
candidates.body: Using the Pubkey `ID` for the candy machine from the mpl_candy_machine program instead of a defined constant. There is also a straightforward way to use a custom candy machine id.

candidates.title: chore: change bundlr dependency to crates.io package
candidates.body: This should fix the build fails on `main`.
